text: The or IMAIMA is an English acronym. IMA stands for "Iwate Museum of Art"; see Iwate Museum of Art (IMA), Symbol Mark . Retrieved 2012-2-8. is a prefectural art museum in northern Honshu. It is at Morioka in Iwate Prefecture.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Museums" in Japan Encyclopedia, pp. 671-673. The museum's art is created by local artists such as Yorozu Tetsugoro, Matsumoto Shunsuke, and Funakoshi Yasutake.IMA, "Message from the Director" . Retrieved 2012-2-8. After the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami, all the temporary exhibitions during April 2011- March 2012 were canceled.IMA, News and topics . Retrieved 2012-2-8. ==History== The museum was opened in 2001. == References == == Other websites == * http://www.ima.or.jp/en/enhome.html . http://www.ima.or.jp/ja/home.html Category:Art museums in Japan Category:Iwate Prefecture Category:2001 establishments in Japan
title: Iwate Museum of Art
